comment: Impact Sensor adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/ImpactSensor/schema.json
description: Smart Data Models Program adaptation of the original IoTData data Models. This Resource provides a status and properties of an impact sensor. Included is the current status (boolean), horizontal and vertical direction (in degrees) and impact level (g force).

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: impactdirectionhorizontal
contents.comment: The 'impactdirectionhorizontal' Property shows a horizontal direction where the impact comes from. The value is 0 to 360 degrees. 0 is the front of the sensor and clockwise increment.

contents.name: impactdirectionvertical
contents.comment: The 'impactdirectionvertical' Property shows a vertical direction where the impact comes from. The value is 0 to 360 degrees. 0 is the front of the sensor and upward increment.

contents.name: impactlevel
contents.comment: The 'impactlevel' Property provides the level of impact. The unit is in 'G' (G-force).

contents.name: impactstatus
contents.comment: The 'impactstatus' Property indicates the impact as: 'true' A physical impact is detected, 'false' Normal status, an impact is not detected.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object

contents.name: if
contents.comment: The OCF Interface set supported by this Resource.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
